content.description:
Start on the low jug and/or flat shelf to the right. Careful on the jug as it may rip out soon.

Follow a crimp and right slanting sloper rail to textured slopers up and right, then the top of a bulge left. Find a glory edge above to top out.

The Coyote Line crack is off.

Feet are delicate and slick on the graffitied bottom face. The top is as good as calavera rock gets.

Landing is rocky and uneven with a downslope behind. 3 or 4 pads is nice.

https://youtu.be/3vZycT2Xo6k
content.location: The face left of the Coyote Line crack.

content.description: Start on the spine of the south face and climb up the spine with right hand and left hand using a undercling on the left. The crux is the pop up move to a small crimp hold for your right hand towards the top of the rock. you have a 6-8 foot fall on some small rocks from here if you miss it. A pad would be nice and spotter even better, but not necessary.
content.location: left spine of the south face wall

content.description:
This route connects the Coyote Line crack to the Lake House spine and tops out up and to the right of the Lake House spine.  The Crux is really the first 3 moves to cross from the crack to the other side of the boulder keeping your feet high and of the bottom.

Photo of the traverse section...crack is behind me.
content.location: Start low on the crack and move to the left to cross over. Then cross left and up toward Lake House but stay RIGHT of the Lake House spine.  Top out up and right of the Lake House route.

content.description: Small crack climb up the south face of Lake View Boulder
